results.name: default/mysql-99874b47f-mc26l
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is unable to pull the Docker image "mysql:5.7" from the registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull mysql:5.7`.

results.name: default/wordpress-744877f9cc-9v8k8
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-99874b47f-mc26l], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service cannot find ready endpoints because the specified pod is not ready.
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod mysql-99874b47f-mc26l`. 3. Resolve any issues like image pull errors or readiness probe failures. 4. Restart pod if necessary.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-744877f9cc-9v8k8], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is not receiving traffic because the pod is not ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs wordpress-744877f9cc-9v8k8`. 3. Ensure readiness probe is correctly configured. 4. Restart pod if needed.
